Reviews.Title: “Would return to Be Playa”
Reviews.Author: jenCALI
Reviews.Content: We wanted to try a night or two away from the "mega" resort we usually stay in the riviera. We chose Be PLaya because it was new and looked very modern. We were not disappointed. The room decor was very nice. And the bed was the most comfortable we had on our trip. The room had an Ipod charger (awesome) and stocked bar, even with champagne glasses. The upstairs pool area is really a gem. We really enjoyed it. I would caution to stay away from the elevator. It was acting very strangely we noticed on the first day (skipping floors, doors not opening) so from then on we took the stairs. Not too bad for a 5 story hotel. But I would not recommend this place for seniors or anybody with trouble climbing. One problem we did have with the room was that the door-less shower allowed for water to run into the sink area. This is a bad situation not only for slipping but also if you are blowdrying your hair. We used quite a bit of towels keeping the floor dry. I cannot comment on the Sushi bar since it was under remodel while we were there. We did eat breakfast one morning. It was just okay, nothing fancy. And also the breakfast staff was really inattentive. Another negative I need to mention was the beach club that the hotel recommends. The hotel gave us vouchers for drinks and chairs at a beach club called "cannibal"-something. Anyway, when we got there we showed the vouchers and the people said that they will give us drinks but only in the restaurant area. So we walked inside (as opposed to outside on the beach) and ordered lunch and drinks. They did honor the voucher and we had lunch which was really good. After that we went outside to the beach chairs to lounge and they said we needed to spend 350 pesos to sit there. We gave them the other voucher and said the hotel sent us and besides we already spent 500 pesos in the restuarant. The beach server suddenly got very very rude and said "nothing in life is free, if you don't spend you have to leave". We were going to buy beers anyway but really did she need to go there?! This kinda pissed me off and we were going to leave but after having walked 12 blocks to get to this place we decided to stay. So given that there are plenty of closer beach clubs with better service I would not bother with the vouchers or this place. OH AND I didn't even mention the worst part -the beach was not even good for swimming!! This is where all the fishing boats park! So really just skip this place. I did tell the women at BE PLAYA about the bad service at the beach club and she said she would talk to them and straighten things out. But anyway, overall as far as Be Playa hotel goes, I would recommend to friends. It was a pretty nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cynthia1828
Reviews.Content: We were a bit leery of booking, as this property is new and few reviews are posted. We've stayed at Hotel La Tortuga a few times in the past (and loved it) but Orbitz was running a deal we couldn't resist. The rooms at Be Playa are far superior to those at La Tortuga -- spacious, immaculate, lovely lighting, and the huge tub was delightful ( the plug was broken and a service person fixed it about 2 minutes after we called). The rooftop deck and pool are equally lovely, particularly if you like solitude, as few guests seemed to use this area. What we missed (and enjoyed at La Tortuga) was a garden-type atmosphere, as Be Playa is quite modern. The free bikes were perfect for cruising around Playa. My husband and I are 43, and I think we were probably the oldest (and least hip) there. I would imagine that older people might find the lighting and stairways to be problematic. Overall, however, Be Playa was a fantastic place to stay and the customer service was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Be Cool in Be Playa”
Reviews.Author: KerryMontreal
Reviews.Content: What a delightful little hotel. Quite literally one minute from 5th ave with all its noise, the hotel is at the quieter end of the pedestrian strip. A nice little sushi bar downstairs, a cool rooftop bar/lounge upstairs and great rooms in between. The staff is always helpful and courteous and the place has the feeling of a hotel for friends. As boutique hotels go, this is one of the best. Now, to be honest, there is some noise penetration. It's not built for sound insulation. One evening, there was some private reception upstairs and we were warned with both an invitation and a couple of complementary beverage coupons, which was a nice touch (if you know you're going to make noise, why not at least invite the neighbours???). All in all a great experience and highly recommendable to all, unless you want standard, well insulated fare in which case good luck at the holiday inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roycastillero
Reviews.Content: Its my 3 visit to Playa del Carmen, and 2 time to Be Playa, the first time was on my honey moon and now we came back with 20 friends to party in Playa. All of mu friends love the hotel, the service, the food, the rooftop pool, full recomended

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anh T
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Very modern and great attention to detail. The rooms are very bright, with natural light and tons of in room lighting as well. It’s located just 1 block from the main strip which is perfect b/c it’s quieter, but you are just steps away from everything! The roof patio/bar/pool is a great place to relax! Ample space and the pool is so refreshing, over -looking the city of Playa Del Carmen. We didn’t get a chance to eat here since we wanted authentic Mexican and not sushi. The bar is great at night and you will enjoy the drinks! The margaritas are to die for! Very delicious and potent! Thanks again for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just have to go Back; FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: preferthebeach68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Be Playa for two weeks and I couldn't wait to return home to write a review. The hotel is new so there are only 26 reviews; all positive but noting a few minor flaws. Hope this review clears up a few noted issues of the past. We loved it here and will return! WiFi: We use apple products and had absolutely no issues; my husband even had to work for a few days which included a large document; he worked on the rooftop and in our room, no problems at all. Shower area: Yes, the shower is very European and does leak into other areas of the washroom but our towels being changed twice a day without asking, was a great surprise that made me forget about a wet floor Elevator: yup still working only intermittently but with only 4 floors, it didn't bother us a bit. The staff care and work on the elevator almost daily...take the stairs folks! Rooms: we only had a standard room and it was small but the lay out, decor and comfort made our room lovely Location: two minute walk to best beach in PDC, 10 seconds to 5th, Five minute walk to the Mega......Fabulous location Staff/management: The best for last!!!!! ALL staff, sushi restaurant (see another review under "Sushi Club"), housekeeping, rooftop guys, front desk......truly caring and thoughtful people. I only wish I could remember names......The young lady and fellow at the front desk were friendly and always greeted us. After a rain storm one day we were greeted at the front entrance with warm towels!!!! The morning breakfast staff, always with a smile. The housekeeping staff honest and attentive to the room and all common areas. AMAZING HOTEL EXPERIENCE....Thank you Be Playa

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service at Be Playa!”
Reviews.Author: Ewelinka87
Reviews.Content: Incredible service at Be Playa! Loved the design and vibe. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and welcoming. Upstairs pool and rooftop patio also stylish and relaxing - wish we hadmore time to relax up there! Meal of sushi was beautiful to look at and absolute perfection, and coming from vancouver, we have very high standards for sushi! Particularly great was the service of the front desk - they helped us retreive a forgotten item at another hotel and were so friendly and helpful about it. Locationwas so convenient for shopping and restaurantsand not too noisy. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Decent location but lacking in luxury.”
Reviews.Author: michaelnudo
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we booked our vacation to PDC. We have been here several times and have stayed at great boutique hotels like Deseo and Basico but thought it was time to try a hotel a bit farther up 5th. The hotel is nice looking and relatively new. That aside, I felt the staff was too casual and not very responsive. For example. my travel mate got stuck in their rusted elevator for a half hour before he was able to be freed. While the even turned out ok the staff at the hotel did not really seem to care or respond appropriately. One desk clerk laughed and simply said with a chuckle, "That was you!" On to the other issues and compliments. The rooms were very well maintained and clean and new which made for a wonderful stay. The air conditioning was effective and the location really perfect for great access to the beach, especially Mamitas beach club. The downsides were: - Unreliable internet connections or none at all - Staff that were mostly interested in their text messaging than helping guests - The restaurant's sushi is way too sweet and served candied ginger with rolls, weird - Not much of a concierge service and generally laid back staff (luckily I've been to PDC before) - Continental breakfast is toast and bowl of fruit which is ok but there are no options to upgrade to a bigger breakfast With a few tweaks and a better guest orientation this hotel could be a contender for a great hotel in PDC. Right now it is a good hotel with nice rooms and a relatively low guest to room ratio which is nice. Also close to everything and quiet at night which is great if you want to sleep in a city known for not sleeping. All in all a good hotel. *except for the elevator fiasco - take the stairs!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners Haven”
Reviews.Author: MiriamGORenzi
Reviews.Content: Dear prospective travelers, This place rocks! My Husband and I stayed here recently for our honeymoon and we were beyond pleased with our stay. Modern, chic, stylish, intimate and bohemian are key words I use when describing this place. Mind you, we're not big fans of the all-inclusive gluttonous resorts, so this place was a hit for us. If you're looking for a huge crazy resort, this place isn't for you. We loved what this hotel had to offer, and it came at a reasonable price. The rooms themselves came equipped with our own personal hot tub - a true gem which we utilized everyday of our stay here. The beds were equally amazing and very comfortable. TV was good quality and had oh so many channels to choose from! Showers and other amenities also proved to be good quality. As for the staff and concierge here - they truly deserve a five star award for how helpful, accommodating, and pleasant they were to us. We got a ton of tips and great recommendations on where to go, what to see, etc. I can't say enough good things about them. They were responsive to our inquiries and always made time to chat with us and bout everything and nothing. It was hands down the best service we've gotten at a hotel in really long time. The Sushi club was delicious and reasonably priced with a great atmosphere and killer lounge music. The Pool was equally cool and very cozy. I can't really think of any setbacks to staying here other than the spotty internet. This was by no means a deal breaker for us since we were, after all, on our honeymoon. The internet was actually quite functional for emails, but if you're planning on using skype I would try the rooftop bar area - the connect there is great! Thank you BePlaya staff and management! You truly made our stay memorable. We can't wait to stay with you again and try your other location ... BeTulum !!!! :) xoxo Miriam & Michael Renzi

Reviews.Title: “beautiful little luxury hotel with so far to go on the service side”
Reviews.Author: mirtone
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel (master suite and Jr Suite) in January 2011 during what seemed to be it's "soft opening" and thus did not review it then. Having tried a few other places in Playa del Carmen over the last year we decided to return this Jan 2012 to see how they are doing. What to expect: Absolutely top notch decore and finishigns, beautifully appointed rooms with very spacious Jr and Master suites (did not see the Standard suite) which have in room round two-person hot-tubs and very over-sized beds and showers. Particular attention is also paid to the lighting, with many tasteful combinations of various lights throughout the rooms to set any atmosphere. The roof-top plunge pool and bar is simply gorgeous at sunset: you can eat at tables in the water (about 4 inches) or lounge in "beech" beds or numerous other sorts of furniture. The included breakfast is very complete and of high quality, the croissants are REAL French pastry, I was astounded! The location is very good: not too close to the "noise" of it all, but definitely a close walk to everything on and off 5th Ave. What you will not get: The quality of service one would expect with the profile of the property. It is actually very disappointing how the foreign staff is almost rude, and by contrast the local "lower" staff is helpful and ever so polite (this dialectic is not uncommon in the Cancun-Puerto Morelos-Playa del Carmen-Tulum region). Overall, if you want a moderately priced oasis of luxury: go for it - but if you need anything from the front desk be prepared! oh, if it matters to you: the hotel wifi network is virtually allergic to Apple products, and the staff could not care less stating they know the problem exists and to try restarting your device...

Reviews.Title: “Beplaya is amazing! The place is how do I say... Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: joelarias
Reviews.Content: Beplaya is amazing! The place is how do I say... Awesome! In my most American accent :) we walked in after our journey from San Diego and were greeted very well. Our rooms was ready for us and we were introduced to one of the most spectacular rooms I have been in for a long while! The last time I was in a room this stylish was at the Media One in Dubai, UAE. the sushi restaurant downstairs was really cool and the music and drinks were excellent. Have not yet tried the Sushi, but will let you know when I do. The rooftop terrace bar and pool were really cool and there is no curfew for using the pool, so enjoy! The rooms are well designed with high quality and the tub in the room was just perfect. If you stay here you are near Mamita's beach club, which I recommend to go when visiting the beach because it has cool chill house music playing and the beach looks great. You can also rent chair, umbrellas and beach beds and enjoy a nice drink on the sand. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Be Playa is Be-autiful”
Reviews.Author: Feelinbeachy43
Reviews.Content: Awesome boutique hotel. The entire hotel is wonderfully decorated, eclectic and fun. I stayed in a Junior Suite (thanks to a promotion on Orbitz) and loved every minute of it. The room is clean, spacious, and has all the necessities needed for a short (or long) stay. The beds are comfortable, so you won’t have any problem sleeping. The shower has double rain shower heads with excellent water pressure and is large enough to share. The tub is an excellent touch, placed in the room so that you can relax while piping music from your iTunes or watch TV – or simply open the doors to the balcony and enjoy the breeze. The best part of this hotel is a toss-up between the rooftop pool/lounge area and the front desk staff. I lounged on the rooftop for a day, alternating between the pool and the lounging beds. The bartender made me a wonderful frozen lemonade and the music was perfect. The hotel staff is very friendly and knowledgeable. All in all, I had a great time at Be Playa. I will stay here again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frode L
Reviews.Content: Clean and new. Located on 10th and 26th. Close to main shopping street on 5th. Great and smiling service from the entire staff. Stayed in room 102, which is probably one of the smaller rooms in the hotel. Very quiet. Rooftop bar and pool was little used. Had it to ourselves several times during the 5 nights we stayed. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: RenniNYC
Reviews.Content: Great, great, great! Well designed, amazing location, very nice staff working there; in particular the Sushi club restaurant is to die for! If you can, ask for the suite at the third floor, do not miss the pool at the rooftop and enjoy this little gem in Playa del Carmen! A single little concern, the WIFI connection should be faster! However, after 2 weeks around mexico we kinda realized that the internet is pretty slow everywhere in the country..

Reviews.Title: “Saved Us”
Reviews.Author: minniapplegal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after having to leave another hotel that was very humid and caused my husband to develop major allergies. This hotel was a lifesaver ! Fresh, airy, and modern rooms. We had a room facing the street and were never bothered by noise . Only complaint is at the time we staryed breakfast was a little slow. The staff was great and very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern hotel, great location and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Noniac
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at Be Playa, a new hotel with beautiful design; every detail is thought through and comes out really outstanding. The service is fantastic; people are very competent, nice and relaxed, and ready to help in any situation. Will definitely be back! It was a pleasure to be there!

Reviews.Title: “Great last 3 days of our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: marijkescholten
Reviews.Content: This hotel had it all, good location (right in the center of playa but you did't hear the noice at night whatsoever). Very clean and nice rooms (we had the master suite with hot tub) with all comfort that comes with it...

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel if you have the opportunity”
Reviews.Author: AntWill
Reviews.Content: I loved it - a hotel that offers fantastic comfort in a stylish setting. The Junior Suite is great - comfortable bed, great shower and everything is functional. The balcony is a really nice spot to relax also but the jewel in the crown is the stunning and spacious roof terrace. The website photos do not do it justice. It is a huge space with four seperate corner areas, a precariously placed swimming pool and fabulous views. Drinks are also served. The service in the hotel is discreet but very good (sometimes slow at the bar in the evening though) although I am not sure if there is room service. The breakfast is delicious. The wireless connection is reasonable. All in all this is a very relaxed accomodating place to stay either as somewhere to totally relax in or as a plush place to treat as a crash pad - it is only 5 minutes from ace beaches, restaurants, bars and clubs. Apparently the Sushi served in the restaurant is the best in the area and so disappointed not to have tried it. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but oh so noisy”
Reviews.Author: sherwoodbaby
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a gamble, at the time there had only been one review and it was positive so we thought we would give it a chance. Firstly the good points: - free wi-fi in rooms - professional ever present staff - AMAZING rooftop bar and chillout area - great bed and sheets - overall clean, modern , pleasing rooms - great location if you want to be in the thick of things - even free apples in the hallways Bad points - the NOISE especially the noise of people om the staircase, out of three nights we did not once get a full nights sleep. - a very very wet floor in the shower/bathroom area as it's not completely sealed off - we only got 1 bottle of water each for the three nights we were there! So over all this hotel was lovely to look at, nice rooms, rooftop, restaurant, professional service and good location but if you value your sleep highly this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Be Playa”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa
Reviews.Content: We chose Be Playa because of it’s funky modern décor. I would consider it more shabby chic, but interesting and we thoroughy enjoyed our stay here. We took advantage of the 4 night stay which included one night at Be Tulum. Our first part of the stay was for 2 nights at Be Playa, and we had a room with two queen beds. We prefer King, but this worked out well. The room was well appointed with a fun Jacuzzi, small sitting area, hammock on the balcony, two sinks, two person shower, and a separate toilet area. Because of the modern bowl type sinks, the counter space was a little limited, but we made due. The room included two free bottles of water (per stay apparently, not per day), and a frig with pay as you use items. Shampoo and soap was supplied, but you might want to bring your own shampoo. Always hot running water in the large showers. A/C worked great. One thing we did have to bring to the attention at check out was that our patio door did not lock and anyone from another room could have hopped over on the balcony easily and gotten in to our room. The other issue we had with this first room was that even tho it had a room safe, it wasn’t bolted to anything! You could simply walk away with it. I considered it a major security issue, and the front desk seemed concerned when I told them. There was a cute rooftop pool/bar/ and lounge area with beds for sunbathing. We never saw anyone up there, and the bar was always closed. I asked at the front desk if we could get drink service up there and was told “of course”, but I guess you’d have to go down and order it yourself, or order it before you went up. That also brings up a point that they don’t have elevators. If they do, they weren’t working or available yet. As part of the promotion, we left on our 3rd day to go to Be Tulum. The hotel provided the transfers and that all went smoothly. Be Tulum is a cute hotel right on the beach, with great service and a wonderful atmosphere. However, Tulum appears to be too quiet for us, so one day/night was just perfect. Upon return to Be Playa, we were then given a room with a King bed, but it was a much smaller room due to that fact. Still appointed well, but arranged differently. This time the patio door locked, and the safe was bolted inside the closet! We never did try the sushi restaurant down in the lobby. We aren’t sushi fans, however it looked very nice. At night they had music playing (not too loud, didn’t bother us up in the room), but there were just a handful of people at the bar. All in all, we were very pleased with the Be Playa/Tulum hotels. We found it to be in a great location and had all the amenities we look for in a small boutique hotel in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Top boutique hotel in the heart of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Ludok
Reviews.Content: Booked originally for 2 nights (when we booked only one review was available on Tripadvisor; a review too good to be true so we prefered to book only the first 2 nights in case we would need to change of hotel), my girlfriend and I stayed in the end 12 amazing nights. The hotel is brand new with very large rooms. We booked the junior suite (room 203) which was amazing. The design (white rooms with wooden floor throughout, flat screen...), the materials, the very large bed are extremely seducing. Our room included a hot tub; it is amazing even if it takes a long time to fill. The shower was very spacious, actually for 2 with 2 shower heads. The service of the hotel is of great quality with people always smilling and prompt. Front desk is very helpful with all you would need to spend great holidays (information about car rentals, sightseeing, restaurants, beaches,...) and bartenders with great cocktails. Concerning the suhsi restaurant located on the ground floor, I have to admit that we were very sceptical of the quality we would find in Playa Del Carmen. However, overcoming this fear we tried it and loved it. Location wise (avenida 5th y calle 26) you are only one block from the famous 5th avenue with 10 min walk to the main restaurants and clubs (Avenida 5th y calle 12). The beach is one block after the 5th avenue; white thin sand and deep blue sea. We are quite picky travellers in terms of hotel and Be Playa checked all the box. We definitely recommend this hotel and will go back again. Many thanks for the great time we had!

Reviews.Title: “Great brand-new boutique hotel in the upscale part of Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: mm6300
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Year's Eve December 31, 2010. It was terrific and I am someone who typically travels on business and stays in Ritz Carlton or JW Marriott hotels. The hotel just opened on December 24, 2010. The hotel is of a modern, fashion-conscious, trendy design. It has four floors with rooms on the top three floors. On the first floor there is a terrific sushi restaurant named Sushi Club that looks just like something out of South Beach. On the roof is a bar and a pool with a beautiful view over Playa del Carmen. The pictures on the hotel web site (behoteles.com) are just like the hotel really looks. The hotel is located just one block west of 5th Avenue (the pedestrian-only main street) in Playa del Carmen, at the northeast corner of 26th street. This is the newer, more upscale part of Playa, with a nice beach club just two blocks away. My room was a standard, which is the smallest they have. But it was huge, with two queen-size beds, plenty of room and special lighting fixtures everywhere (under the bed platform, beside each night stand, high hats over each bed, etc.). There was a large flat-screen tv suspended from the wall so you could easily adjust it to view from either bed. The bathroom had a walk-in shower with frosted glass walls on one side, two separate shower heads in the "rain shower" style, and tile or marble on three sides. The bathroom also had two modern above counter sinks and a toilet enclosed in a frosted glass walled separate side room. The hotel staff all were very helpful, friendly and extremely service-oriented. Even though the hotel had only been open for a week when I stayed there, the staff were all very professional and experts at their work. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Playa del Carmen. And let me just close by saying this review is coming from a traveler with very high expectations!
